fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3444].
  {panel}

Hi Team,

JIRA cloud is not available for about an hour. Some of the users of the Porto Seguro project got logged out and they receive an "authentication" error. 
I am not able to open any dashboard, make an extract. 
Please advise when the problem will be solved. It is critical for our daily activities! 

BR,
Lyubov Pencheva
fields.summary: JIRA is not available

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3443].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As per current email notification in HTML format , when issue is created with HTML coding/scripting , email notfication content will be send as text format . It is because JSD doesn't support the language and reformat it . 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow HTML coding/scripting in issue description and format it in the email notication.
fields.summary: Allow HTML scripting for Email Notification description

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3442].
  {panel}

The "Create with shared configuration" currently take over the following configurations when creating a new project:
* Permission Scheme
* Notification Scheme
* Issue Security Scheme
* Workflow Scheme
* Issue Type Scheme
* Issue Type Screen Scheme
* Field Configuration Scheme

For Service Desk projects though it is very convenient to have request types implemented in this function as well. In particular in situations where Customer organisations are separated from each other on a project base, where the usage across projects is the same, this causes overhead on setting up projects for new customer organisations
fields.summary: Incorporate Request type into the "create with shared configuration" option
JSD customers are Jira users with no application access
Changing request type using automation rules causes issues to get into an invalid workflow state
It will be great if we have chatting feature between Customer and Agent

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3437].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create some issues and complete their SLA's
# Got to the issue navigator and sort issues by SLA

h3. Expected Results

Issues are correctly ordered based on the SLA field

h3. Actual Results

Issues are not ordered

 !Screen Shot 2016-02-18 at 11.27.28.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

Only happens to completed SLAs. Ongoing ones are ordered correctly.
fields.summary: Unable to sort issues by SLA time when it's completed.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3436].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

When SD customer click _Satisfaction Feedback_ on the email notification, it will be redirected to _Satisfaction Feedback page_ where they can add the rating and leave a comment. The current wording for every selected rating are:
- Sorry to hear that
- Thanks! We got it.
- Awesome! We Got it. 

It is not currently possible to update that.

h3. Suggested Resolution

It would be great if users can have an option to edit the wordings.
fields.summary: Customize Satisfaction Feedback wording on every selected rating

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Jira Service Desk Cloud*. Using *Jira Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3432].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently it is not possible to edit logo that is sent by Jira Service Desk customer notifications. It defaults to the Jira Logo set here:
- <https://EXAMPLE.atlassian.net>/secure/admin/LookAndFeel!default.jspa 

This causes and issue when using a white logo since the email is also white.  

h3. Suggested Solution

* Add the ability to send Jira Service Desk portal logo instead.
or
* Have the ability to choose the logo sent our via Jira Service Desk notifications

h3. Workaround 

None at this time. End user will need to avoid using white logos when setting up Jira's look and feel.
fields.summary: Allow a custom logo to be set for JSD notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3431].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Support Satisfaction Survey sent out on Resolved issues when the Request was created through JIRA Backend

This appears to be due to the Request Type not being set when a Request is Created in JIRA instead of through the Service Desk Portal
_(see JSD-1809)_

h3. Suggested Solution
Send Support Satisfaction Survey on all requests resolved in the Service Desk Project
 
h3. Workaround 
- Create all Service Desk Requests through the Service Desk Portal
or
- When creating Service Desk issues through JIRA, manually set the Request Type 
-- Request Type will show {color:red} No Match {color} if not set
!CreatedInJIRA.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Send Support Satisfaction Survey on Requests without Service Desk Request Type
Non-Participant Comment Creates a New Ticket
Allow partner to change status to resolved/closed
Inaccurate/incomplete information on "Setting up Service Desk users" page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3427].
  {panel}

Project administrators in Service Desk projects are capable of inviting agents to the Service Desk team of that project. This however only works if the agent in question has already been provided with an Agent slot on the JIRA Service Desk license.
As a result, one of 3 different situations can occur:
# If the user that the project administrator wants to invite *does not* have an Agent license, and the project administrator *does not* have JIRA Administrator permissions, the user *will not* show up in the user picker at all.
# If the user that the project administrator wants to invite *does not* have an Agent license, and the project administrator *does* have JIRA Administrator permissions, the user *will* show up in the user picker and can get added. A subscript message will be shown that 1 additional license slot will be consumed.
# If the user that the project administrator wants to invite *does* have an Agent license, the user *will* show up in the user picker, regardless of the fact that the project administrator has been provided with JIRA Administrator permissions.

Situation 1 can cause confusion whenever project admins have been made responsible for setting up the Service Desk team. In many situations, providing them full instance administration permissions is not an option since this provides them a lot more privileges than required and wanted.
Instead, in situation 1 all users should be possible in the user picker, regardless of their license positions. If a user can not get added due to not having the appropriate license, a message should indicate that a JIRA Administrator needs to get contacted to provide the appropriate license to these kind of users.
fields.summary: Provide a better description on agent invites performed by Project Administrators

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3425].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently an agent can create a JIRA Service Desk issue within JIRA without a request type specified.  You can specify the request type on the view issue screen but not the create issue screen. You can specify the issue type but it will not fill out the request type according to issue type>request match.  It will produce a "No Match" on the view issue screen after the issue is created even though the issue type is configured for the request type. This is because one issue type can map to several request types so this can't be done automatically. 

See [Configuring request types and workflows |https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/configuring-request-types-and-workflows-732528910.html] and [How JIRA and JIRA Service Desk work together|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk025/how-jira-and-jira-service-desk-work-together-754977568.html] for reference. 
!nomatch.png|thumbnail!

Since you cannot specify the request type from create issue view within JIRA. It leaves a possibility that a customer may not be updated if an agent creates an issue from within JIRA.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Since issues should be created via the customer issues should be created via the customer portal by design. Agents should be directed to a JIRA Service Desk Create issue screen where the request type can be specified via either the customer portal, a modified create issue screen, or request type appears on the create issue screen if project type = Service Desk is specified.
fields.summary: Add a drop down option "Service Desk Request" to the Create issue button in JIRA.
Add the ability to search for other fields on Customer Portal
Provide system account ability to manage filters/subscriptions without consuming agent license.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3422].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently , if agent attached an images or files in comment , customer will get email notifications with attachment link that will go to the issue portal . It will be better is the images and files is added to the email as attachment.

h3. Suggested Solution
Attached the images and files to the email notifications
fields.summary: As customer , would like to get email notification with images as attachment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3421].
  {panel}

Currently, several permissions have been granted to the "Customer Portal Access" entity, despite the functionality to provide these permissions the customer user types not being in place yet.
These permissions have been granted as placeholders for potential future feature releases.

This means, that as soon as such a feature gets release, and the JIRA Admin of the JIRA environment upgrades Service Desk, the customers in that environment will automatically get that permission granted.
This can pose a security issue if the JIRA Admin does not *want* customers to have these permissions.

Please remove these placeholders to prevent the potential security issue from above to occur. Instead, we need to properly inform customers when new feature become available, and which steps they need to take in order to provide these features to their customer.
fields.summary: Remove Customer Portal Access entity from all permissions currently not implemented

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3420].
  {panel}
h3. Problem Definition
Allow customers to create request directly from *Created by me*.  Currently user will have to navigate all the way back to the correct customer portal to raise a ticket. 
h3. Suggested Solution
There should be a button at *Created by me* to allow customers to raise a ticket directly to the customer portal of their choosing without having to navigate all the way back to the specific portal. 

Alternatively, display a button/link to redirect the customer to the portal again.
fields.summary: Allow user to create new request from "Created by me"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3419].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

When Service Desk customer opens a request at {{https://<instance URL>/servicedesk/customer/portal/5/<issue key>}}, it is not currently possible to see the workflow.

h3. Suggestion Resolution

It would be great to have an option to display workflow on a customer's ticket.
fields.summary: Option to display workflow in Customer Portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3417].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, after moving an Issue from SD.A to SD.B, there will be no notification email on this. Hence, replying to the Issue creation notification email will not update the Issue. This is due to the request type is being mapped on the Issue when the Issue is being moved.

h3. Suggested Solution
At the Issue Moved wizard, on "Update Fields", prompt the user to map the Request Type.

h3. Workaround 
For now, manually set the Request Type and add a comment so that the customer will receive a notification email on the Issue Moved.
fields.summary: Issue Moved notification

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3416].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When unknown user sends E-Mail to JIRA ServiceDesk mail handler, since they are not registered users the issue won't be created, but customer assumes ticket has been created and they wait for reply from Agents.

h3. Solution
It would be useful and avoids the confusion, if JIRA ServiceDesk sends an E-Mail to users that their issue is not created due to some reasons. i.e, no account, permission or etc. 
This can be optional, in case some of the companies are not interested in this option.
fields.summary: Mail Handler To Reply To Unknown Users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3412].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA Service Desk report , doesn't provide report about user history on viewing Confluence page . 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide report about user list viewing which Confluence page daily .
fields.summary: As admin , would like to create report about User history viewing Confluence page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3411].
  {panel}

h3. +Problem Definition+
Currently, when an email have emoticons in it, the issue creation will be rejected by JIRA Service Desk *if MySQL is used as the JIRA database*.

!Screen Shot 2016-02-15 at 3.57.25 PM.png|thumbnail!

In the log, the following error should be seen:
{code}
Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO jiraissue (ID, pkey, issuenum, PROJECT, REPORTER, ASSIGNEE, CREATOR, issuetype, SUMMARY, DESCRIPTION, ENVIRONMENT, PRIORITY, RESOLUTION, issuestatus, CREATED, UPDATED, DUEDATE, RESOLUTIONDATE, VOTES, WATCHES, TIMEORIGINALESTIMATE, TIMEESTIMATE, TIMESPENT, WORKFLOW_ID, SECURITY, FIXFOR, COMPONENT) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (Incorrect string value: '\xF0\x9F\xA4\x94\x0D\x0A...' for column 'DESCRIPTION' at row 1)
{code}

h3. +Cause+
This is because email emoticons use 4-byte characters, while MySQL doesn't support this:
* [Add support for 4 byte characters in MySQL connection|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-36135?src=confmacro&_ga=1.254773761.864456436.1434006745]

h3. +Suggested Solution+
JIRA Service Desk should auto render the emoticons as text, so that issues will be successfully created.

(i) This will also work if 4-byte characters are supported in MySQL.

h3. +Workaround+
Switch to a different type of supported databases: Postgre, MS SQL, or Oracle.
fields.summary: As admin, would like issue creation from email accept email with emoticon

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3410].
{panel}
Currently if my service desk agent is on the watcher list and also added as a request participant, the agent will not receive any JIRA notification (such as internal comment notification). It would be good agents received internal notifications, despite being in the context of customers of the request.
h3. Notes

This also affects if the agents are in the same organisation as the reporter.
h3. Follow Up

Since this use case is not fully implemented yet, we've raised a new bug report. Please consider giving feedback at JSDCLOUD-10323.
fields.summary: I would like my Service Desk agent to receive JIRA notification even if they are a request participant/reporter/part of Organization
Tested version on JIRA Service Desk API documentation is inaccurate

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3401].
  {panel}

Hey Team

Our JIRA instance is:  https://visualjazz.jira.com/

I'm in charge of our (~50) Service Desks and am having some trouble with emails.

The ticket notification emails are coming through OK, and the replies are logging with the system fine.

The issue lies with the "Invitation" emails, when you invite a customer to join a Service Desk, and with the "Reset Password" emails, from the Service Desk Portal.

Many of our clients are reporting that these are just not being received.  I can think of at least 10 reports this year.

Is this a common issue?  Is there any way to resolve this without trying to have the domain whitelisted?

Thanks in advance for your help!
Donna
fields.summary: "Invitation" emails and "Password Reset" emails not delivered

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3400].
  {panel}

Currently we have Jira Service Desk installed as an Add-on for Jira.
As we continue to use JSD more and more, we want to customize the priorities that are in place for Service Desk.
Given how we have JSD implemented, changing the priorities will affected Jira as well.

I came across another ticket - JRA-3821
That had something similiar to this, however I wanted to reach out with this suggestion since it's directly related to JSD.

Thoughts?
fields.summary: Allow for Service Desk to use it's own priority schema while not impacting Jira's Priorities

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3399].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In many cases, the feedback provided by a customer is something that should not be seen directly by the agent, as it can contain information intended for management. Administrators may also want to provide an environment where customers feel more comfortable submitting surveys, knowing that the agent that worked the ticket will not be able to see the result.

h3. Suggested Solution
As an administrator, I would like to have a configurable satisfaction survey permission that will add the ability to hide survey results and reports from Agents.
fields.summary: Add Configurable View Satisfaction Survey Permission
Create service desk users with API REST

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3393].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently , there's no way to set when user is mention in comment it trigger issue transition.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide configuration to transition issue when user is mention.
fields.summary: As admin , would like to configure when user been mention it will trigger transition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3392].
  {panel}

h5. Experienced Behavior

JIRA users are able to view Service Desk requests when granted "Browse Project" permission. These users are automatically able to view internal comments. 

h5. Expected Behavior: 

JIRA users are able to view Service Desk request when granted "Browse Project" permission but are not able to view internal comments unless they are a part of the Service Desk Team. 

h5. Suggested Resolution: 

Use project roles to determine if internal comments should be shown to users. A user who has "Browse Project" permission but no project roles should be able to view the request but not any internal comments. Users with "Browse Project" permission should be able to view internal comments when added to a project role such as "Service Desk Team" "Administrators" or "Developers"
fields.summary: Restrict internal comments to only users listed in project roles

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3390].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When an agent (listed in request participant) adds a comment to trigger an automation (Transition on Comment), the automation is not triggered.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an automation to Transition on Comment
# Add an agent as a Request Participant
# Login as the agent, add a comment

h3. Expected Results
Issue is transitioned
h3. Actual Results
Issue is not transitioned

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Automation does not trigger when agent is listed in Request Participant
SLA information will appear in both the customer-facing request and the internal issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3388].
  {panel}

h3. Summary:
Somehow, by trying to drag the Request Type row number 8 from top, it will automatically scroll the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Navigate to a Service Desk Project Administration Page.
# Select Request Type.
# Create about 30 Request Type
# Try to drag or re-ordering the Request Type on row 8 from top.

h3. Expected Result:
* There will be no scrolling happening until the cursor is on the edge of top or bottom of the windows.

h3. Actual result:
* Moving it a little bit will somehow scrolling the page to the bottom.
fields.summary: Re-ordering Request Type will automatically scroll down the page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*[#anchor]NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3387].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

In Service Desk Customer Portal, the *Requests* page only shows a few columns by default.
h3. Suggested Solution

Examples would be Created Date, Updated Date. These aren't fields that show in the same way as other fields, but the users would like some way to display this information in the Customer Portal


**

*UPDATE by [~6cf75f652d57]*

*We have released the following:* 
 # Jira Admins can remove any existing column in the request list page (customer portal) 
 # Jira Admins can add the following columns
 ## created date
 ## Updated date
 ## Due date
 ## Assignee
 ## Priority
 # Your *customers can now sort* on most of these columns. 

*How to do this:* 

If you are a Jira Admin, you can go to 'https://<your instance>/servicedesk/customer/user/requests?page=1', and click on the 'Customize' sidebar, you should be able to customize the columns that your customers see in this page. 

[Support Documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/untitled-entry-2021-03-05-at-09-29-32/]
fields.summary: As an admin, ability to specify which columns show in Service Desk requests page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3385].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When creating a Service Desk project for the first time, if a default issue type that would be created during the project creation process already exists, it must match the intended case sensitivity or project creation will fail.

For example:
If an issue type exists titled "INCIDENT", project creation will fail when creating an IT Service Desk as the process is attempting to create an issue type titled "Incident". This would also fail with any other case configuration that differs from the default "Incident", such as "INCident","InciDENT",etc..

h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk v3.2.0-OD-01-001
* JIRA Service Desk v3.1.0-OD-12-001

h3. Steps to Reproduce
On an instance that currently doesn't contain a Service Desk project:
# Create an Issue Type titled "INCIDENT"
# Attempt to create an IT Service Desk
# Observe error:
 - {code}Hmm... we couldn't create your project due to an unknown error. Try refreshing the page to start again.{code}

h3. Expected Results
Projected should be created, using existing issue type's case structure.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the JIRA log file:
{noformat}
2016-02-02 11:23:40.130911500 2016-02-02 11:23:40,122 http-nio-2990-exec-1301 ERROR sysadmin 683x221172x1 1ar6uib 4.15.43.214,165.254.226.114,127.0.0.1 /rest/project-templates/1.0/templates [c.a.jira.project.ProjectCreateRegistrarImpl] The handler with id com.atlassian.jira.project-templates-plugin:apply-project-template-handler threw an exception while handling a notification about a project being created
2016-02-02 11:23:40.130915500 java.lang.IllegalStateException: An issue type with the name 'Incident' exists already.
2016-02-02 11:23:40.130977500 	at com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultIssueTypeManager.createIssueTypeAndAddToDefaultScheme(DefaultIssueTypeManager.java:141)
2016-02-02 11:23:40.130978500 	at com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultIssueTypeManager.createIssueTypeAndAddToDefaultScheme(DefaultIssueTypeManager.java:171)
2016-02-02 11:23:40.130978500 	at com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultIssueTypeManager.createIssueType(DefaultIssueTypeManager.java:98)
2016-02-02 11:23:40.130986500 	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor14289.invoke(Unknown Source)
2016-02-02 11:23:40.130987500 	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
2016-02-02 11:23:40.130988500 	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
2016-02-02 11:23:40.130996500 	at com.atlassian.plugin.util.ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.invoke(ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.java:26)
2016-02-02 11:23:40.130996500 	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy73.createIssueType(Unknown Source)
2016-02-02 11:23:40.130997500 	... 2 filtered
{noformat}

h3. Notes
This has been verified on all issue types associated with the default Service Desk project templates. Project creation does not fail with the same scenario for JIRA Software and Business project templates.

h3.Workaround
- Edit the existing Issue Type to the default intended case sensitivity, and re-attempt project creation.
- If you would prefer a different case sensitivity of your issue types, you can create the service desk project and then edit the issue type afterwards.
fields.summary: Unable to create Service Desk Project if Issue Type exists with Different Case Sensitivity
Don't define Request Type als renderable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3381].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently , agent is not allowed to move ticket to other Service Desk project that he/she doesn't have agent role to the project he/she want to move the ticket to . 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide different permission for agent to move ticket from a project to another project eventhough he/she not the agent of the project he/she want to move the ticket to .
fields.summary: As agent , would like to move ticket to other Service Desk project without having agent role to it .
Service desk rest APIs should use JSON date format like JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3378].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Plain text email notification should not show wiki markup in plain text for Inline Attachments

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set user profile preference in JIRA to use plain text email
# add a comment with attachment to trigger notification e.g. content below:
{noformat}
Hi test,

 [^user.csv]

– admin
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
Email notifications don't show wiki markup in plain text, but instead may provide a link to download the attachment

h3. Actual Results
Text email notification contains the wiki markup for inline attachment in plain text exactly as below:
{noformat}
Hi test,

 [^user.csv]

– admin
{noformat}
fields.summary: Plain text email notification should not show wiki markup in plain text for Inline Attachments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3377].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Service Desk Customers are unable to login to their Service Desk using email address as credentials, need to use only username instead

h3. Suggested Solution
As Agents and JIRA/Confluence Users are able to choose whether to use username or email address as credential to log into their instance, Service Desk Customers (who are apart of the same Domain) should be able to have the same option too
 
h3. Workaround 
Login by using Username and Password combination
fields.summary: Allow Service Desk customers to login by using email address

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3376].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Only JIRA Service Desk auto create workflow will having statuses with "No category" options for Category section. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide "No Category" options for new custom status.
fields.summary: As admin , would like to have "No category" option to custom status

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3375].
  {panel}

hi

When a customer is logged into the customer portal they cant search for a ticket based on the "Details" in their ticket. They can only search on the "Reference, "Summary" and "Comments".

This leads to duplication of tickets for our support desk and thus more tickets for us to process and manage.

If they could search the contents of their own tickets and tickets they are participating on as well then this would make for a more productive service desk - agents working tickets that are genuine.

Thanks
Barry
fields.summary: Search on the Customer Portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3374].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When a request is raised on behalf of an existing customer, there isn't any way to identify that the request has been raised that way. It just looks as if the customer him/herself raised it. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a custom field, or an automated comment that helps to inform the customer that the request was being raised on behalf of him or her. 
 
h3. Workaround 
None. The agent raising the request could add a comment to the ticket to mention that its being raised on behalf of the user, but that's a manual way of doing things and not very easy to track.
fields.summary: Raising Request on behalf of existing customer should show that its being raised that way
Would be great to have custom report in Service Desk by a Group wise
Alerts in Automation need improving

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for {*}JIRA Service Desk Cloud{*}. Using {*}JIRA Service Desk Server{*}? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3371].
{panel}
{panel:title=Update as of 2 December 2021}
Hello all, 

Thank you for all of your eager follow-ups. Unfortunately I have to share some bad news.

We have had to redirect some of the resources on this project to an urgent need. Progress continues, but at a slower pace. As such, we are going to miss the end of year cut off, and this feature will now be pushed back to Q1 CY 2022.

I know this is not what you all wanted to hear. My sincere apologies. This feature is definitely coming.

Cheers, 

Ben.
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if an attachment is included in a notification, an inline preview of the attachment is visible within the e-mail notification. Attempting to access the attachment redirects to the instance's hosted location of the attachment, requiring the user to login to the instance to retrieve the full attachment.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the option for attachments to be included as an actual e-mail attachment within the e-mail notification so that the attachment can be downloaded directly from the e-mail without having to login to the instance.
h3. Use Case

Many Service Desks operate strictly via e-mail with their user base. Requiring the user to login to the instance adds extra steps and therefore making the process inefficient to work with.
fields.summary: Allow Attachments to be included as an actual Email Attachment
Display error message if a customer tries to open the customer portal with an unsupported browser

h3. Suggested Solution

fields.summary: Encrypted Format for Attachment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3366].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Customer Accounts (therefore, Customer Portal Access only) are coming up as an option to use as a Project Lead/Default Assignee in Service Desk.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.1.0-OD-05-006
* JIRA Service Desk - 3.2.0-OD-01-001-D20160127T101633

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On an instance with SD and valid customer accounts, navigate to a project (any type, does not need to be SD)
# Go to *Project Administration > Users and Roles*
# Click *Edit Defaults* in top-right
# Type the name of a customer account, and it displays in the search results.

 !Screen Shot 2016-02-02 at 10.58.44.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The search results should only display users that should have access to be added as a Project Lead. Especially not Customer accounts.

h3. Actual Results
Customer accounts are displayed as potential options for Project Lead

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: As administrator, able to select Customer Account as Project Lead / Default assignee

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3365].
  {panel}

Our business is split across 7x different site locations each with their own local site admins and facilities management as well as central management reporting.

When an issue is reported via JIRA the user is required to specify the site affected, I would like to set automation to automatically add the local facility management and central management as watchers so they are aware of the issue from inception.

Although this is something the service desk agents can do manually it would be good to automate this repetitive action that will occur for every single issue raised.

Please can you add the ability to assign watchers to the automation facilities.
fields.summary: As a system administrator I want to automatically assign watchers based upon issue fields
Add public REST API to server version of JIRA Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3355].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The new feature of https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESKCLOUD/2016/01/08/Improved+My+Requests+page allow customers a more define search. However, a user will have to perform a search for every different ticket the customer wants to find. This would be tedious if
* It is common to raise a lot of issues (around 10 per day)
* Involved in many different Service Desk projects

h3. Suggestion
Allow customers to save their search
fields.summary: Ability for customers to create and save a custom filters in the Customer Portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3354].
  {panel}

Hello,

When one user that don't access to Jira apps but is created on Jira can create issues by service desk user portal, but when try to send a mail to an incoming mail get this error

Cannot create issue due to invalid license: [Sorry, you can't create any issues right now, as you need to have access to a JIRA application to be able to create issues. To gain application access you need to be a member of a group assigned to an application.]

When I check project permission, "Service Desk Customer - Portal Access" is on Create Issue, could be great that one user than already can create make it by mail.

BR
fields.summary: User from servicedesk portal can't create issue by email

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3353].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Diagnosis:
In Service Desk, we could configure multiple SLA on one project and there is a chance that the issue will met every SLA conditions. This will make the issue show all SLA in the JIRA Issue details view regardless of the status of the SLA, hence if there is 9 SLA on the ticket and only 2 that is actually still running, the rest of the SLA will still shown when it should be less important compare to the running SLA.

h3. Suggested Feature:
Hence, it will be great if we have a feature to hide any SLA that is currently not running it would be great. We could group the SLA together when it is Paused or Stopped in one section that could be expanded/collapse by the user. This will make the SLA details more neat.
fields.summary: Option to Hide Paused/Stopped SLA
Service Desk queue information to be shown on Issue Details.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3347].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition 
Out of office emails can be a big issue for an organization which is growing in number of users. Therefore receiving such emails for various tickets can waste time off ServiceDesk agent.  

h3. Suggested Solution
By filtering out "out of office" emails we can reduce this traffic and prevent them from adding comment to the tickets.

This plugin [Enterprise Mail Handler for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.javahollic.jira.jemh-ui/cloud/overview] or other sort of plugins can be used as workaround. 
(!) Please contact the plugin's vendor in order to make sure about functionality as Atlassian does not support third party plugins.
fields.summary: Ability To Filter Out of Office Auto Emails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3346].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Under Applications > Service Desk Configuration, the following description is under Notifications:
{quote}This setting controls all service desk projects. If this setting is enabled, customers receive email notifications when they raise a request through the Customer Portal, when their request is resolved, when another user comments on their request, and when there is a change in the request's status.{quote}

As SD customers are no longer notified when a status transition occurs in a request, this information needs to be updated to avoid confusion.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to Applications > Service Desk Configuration
# Look under Notifications

h3. Expected Results
The info on being notified during status transitions should not be there.
fields.summary: SD Notification Configuration Contains Inaccurate Info
Better overview of the detailed automation rule configuration
bulk operation - add ability to edit "participants" to service desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3338].
  {panel}

POSTing to 
{noformat}
servicedeskapi/servicedesk/{serviceDeskId}/requesttype/{requestTypeId}/field
{noformat}
returns "201 Created", but does not actually have an apparent effect.

* I'm an admin user
* I have service desk license on the project
* Return value includes an ID, but further RequestType methods return 404 for queries using the returned ID
*  The Request Type does not appear in project admin > request types

Documented here:
[https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/REST/latest/#servicedeskapi%2Fservicedesk%2F%7BserviceDeskId%7D%2Frequesttype]
fields.summary: Request Type created via API is unavailable
Request type field resource always returns 404

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3336].
  {panel}

The resource at
{noformat}
servicedeskapi/servicedesk/{serviceDeskId}/requesttype/{requestTypeId}/field
{noformat}
needs a corresponding PUT / POST method, so that Request Type config can be managed via API.
documented here:
[https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/REST/latest/#servicedeskapi%2Fservicedesk%2F%7BserviceDeskId%7D%2Frequesttype%2F%7BrequestTypeId%7D%2Ffield]


Use case:
I would like to build a small app to clone / create project from template.
Creating a project from "shared configuration" does not work.
I will be managing dozens of service desks, and configuring Request Types takes a _long_ time.
fields.summary: Create / PUT method for request type fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3335].
  {panel}

If you have a comment restriction for rules like "Transition on comment" and a "Alert user", the "Ready For Support" and "Respond to Customer" buttons won't trigger the Alert.


*Steps tro Reproduce*
{quote}
1. Create a new user and add it to a GroupX, for example;

2. Create the first Automation Rule:
*Transition on comment*
*When* _Issue Commented_ *if* _Status = "Waiting for Support" and "Customer Request Type" is not empty_ *and* _comment is public_ *and* _user is not a customer_ *then* _Transition to Respond to Customer_
*Else if* _Status = "Waiting for Customer" and "Customer Request Type" is not empty_ *and* _comment is public_ *and* _user is a customer_ *then* _Transition to Ready for Support_

3. Create the second *custom* Automation Rule:
*When* _Issue Commented_ *if* _status in ("Waiting for Support", "Waiting for Customer")_ *and* _reporter in (membersOf(GroupX))_ *and* _comment is internal_ *Then* _Alert Users xx_

4. Create a ticket through customer portal with the user recently created.
5. Use an Agent to Respond to customer with an internal comment. 
{quote}

*Expected behaviour*
The issue is transitioned, an internal comment is posted and an Alert will be triggered.

*Current Behaviour*
The issue is transitioned with an internal comment, but with no Alert triggered.

JIRA Service Desk v3.1.0-OD-12-001-D20160118T065214
fields.summary: Transition button doesn't comment on ticket
Filtering requests by status on customer portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3333].
  {panel}

My organisation is currently in the process of migrating to JIRA Service Desk from our existing supplier, but one of the features that I am unable to identify within JIRA SD is the function to set the call status to automatically change on a given time/date.  For example, a request is logged but doesn't need to start until two weeks later, therefore we change the call status to 'On-Hold', but then specify the time and date when we would like the call status to automatically change to 'Open'.

This is an extremely important feature for us and would require this if we are to complete our migration.  Could I request that this feature is added at your earliest possible convenience please.  One possible way that I see this working in JIRA would be to add an Auto Status Change feature within a Workflow Transition.  However, I'm still fairly new to this so you may be able to advise of another solution.

I look forward to hearing from you.

Many thanks
Nathan
fields.summary: URGENT - Auto Status Change Functionality Required

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3332].
  {panel}

h3.Summary

Auto-search on request forms is not displaying Request Types after reloading the page or after clicking on the _Workflow_ tab.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Navigate to {{https://<instance URL>/servicedesk/admin/<project key>/confluence-kb}}
# Link it to Confluence Space
# Select any Space -> Link
# If the _Request Types_ are shown, refresh the page OR
# Go to _Workflow_ Tab -> navigate back to _Knowledge Base_

h3.Expected Result

_Request Types_ are displayed

h3.Actual Result

_Request Types_ are not shown

h3.Workaround

Navigate to _Request Types_ tab and go back to _Knowledge Base_ tab.

h3.Error

Found below error message in the Network Console.
{noformat}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'requiredBooleanSelectRead' of undefined

j.extend.each	@	batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:35
AJS.RestfulTable.Row.s.View.extend.render	@	com.atlassian.servicedesk:restful-table.js?locale=en-US:24
AJS.RestfulTable.i.View.extend._renderRow	@	com.atlassian.servicedesk:restful-table.js?locale=en-US:12

AJS.RestfulTable.i.View.extend.renderRows	@	com.atlassian.servicedesk:restful-table.js?locale=en-US:12
AJS.RestfulTable.i.View.extend.populate	@	com.atlassian.servicedesk:restful-table.js?locale=en-US:12
(anonymous function)	@	com.atlassian.servicedesk:restful-table.js?locale=en-US:12

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3327].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

It is not clear that the JIRA User permission is required for all Service Desk roles except for Customers.  For customers that switch to agent based pricing with pre-existing custom permission schemes it is difficult to know what needs to be done to get everything working correctly.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add a note at [Mandatory permissions by project roles|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk025/using-custom-permission-schemes-754977475.html#Usingcustompermissionschemes-Mandatorypermissionsbyprojectroles]:

Members of these project roles must have the "JIRA User" [global permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/managing-global-permissions-185729559.html] with the exception of "Service Desk Customers".
fields.summary: Clarify that JIRA User global permission is required for all non-Customer users.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3326].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Raw HTML is visible in the page which appears to be a broken link.  I'm not sure where it should link to in order to fix it.

h3. Environment
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk025/resolving-permission-scheme-errors-754977477.html#Resolvingpermissionschemeerrors-WhatdoestheFixpermissionsbuttondo?

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Follow the link and look for "Standard permissions page"

h3. Expected Results
A clickable link should be visible.

h3. Actual Results
Raw HTML is visible: [screenshot|https://www.evernote.com/l/AAQ9c2B6gXxMoKGK3k5-MNnadsE-V5cNaA4]
fields.summary: Raw HTML visible in doc "Resolving permission scheme errors"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3325].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As a Service Desk Agent, I would like to have the ability to export any queue from the SD view, instead of copying the queue query to Issue Navigator.

h3. Suggested Solution
Include an option to Export Service Desk Queues to CSV or Excel (HTML) to be used in reporting
 
h3. Workaround 
Copy the JQL Query used in the Service Desk Queue into the Issue Navigator Search and use the export options there
fields.summary: Ability to export Service Desk queues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3324].
  {panel}

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/JIRA+Service+Desk+permissions

Update the documentation to reflect that normal JIRA Project Permissions are not honored in the same way with Service Desk Projects as they are in typical JIRA Projects. This is reflected in these two Service Desk Feature Requests:

[JSD-861: Jira Service Desk should not restrict Project actions| https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-861]
[JSD-931: Allow collaborators to modify issues dependent on their permissions | https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-931]

The documentation does state:
_Each type of user displayed on the People tab of your service desk matches a JIRA project role, and the project permissions for each type of user are assigned to the JIRA project roles in the permission scheme_

However, it should be clear that just because a certain permission is granted in the Project's Permission Scheme, it doesn't mean that the permission is granted in the Service Desk Project according to the Service Desk Project Roles, and that the Service Desk Project Permission Scheme does not take precedence.
fields.summary: Update Service Desk Documentation to Reflect that Project Permissions are Not As Relevant

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3319].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it's possible to allow all logged in SD customers to access the Knowledge Base in Confluence that's assigned to a given Service Desk. However, this also gives access to all Confluence users. If a user wants only SD customers to access but not Confluence users, it is not possible.

I tried locking out all Confluence users in page restrictions, but you cannot specify "cannot view/edit" only "can". Also cannot specify in Space Permissions who cannot view, only can.

So when you lock out everybody *except* admins, this will include also the SD customers.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow a choice to lock out non-SD customers from KB, such as Confluence users.
 
h3. Workaround 
No known workaround
fields.summary: Allow closing of Service Desk KB to Confluence users
Allow Help Center to be accessible even without logging in
Customer to get notified of their own changes.
Internal KB articles for agents in JIRA SD issue screen
Ability to Filter Users in the Customers Section

fields.description:

  {panel}

h3. Summary
At the moment, only Administrators of a Service Desk has the permission to create reports. Agents can view all reports but cannot create their own report.

Give the administrators an option on whether to allow Agents to create Service Desk reports

An option to turn off or customize the auto response mail notification

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3310].
  {panel}

We need to create an JIRA Servicedesk ticket via JIRA api.
So far we successfully create a ticket via JIRA API but we are not able to flag the created ticket, so that it will be visible at the JIRA Servicedesk.

What kind of Property is needed to make it visible/marked as an Servicedesk ticket.
The brand new servicedesk API is at the time unfortunately not an option.
fields.summary: Create ticket via API and make it visible in JIRA Servicedesk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3308].
  {panel}

As a company, we don't want the customer to see the concrete name of the agent (or 2nd Level Support) who is working on a ticket

Because we don't want the customers to get in contact with a concrete agent next time (i.e. by phone)

how can we hide the agents name in the customer portal?

There should be a toggle in the admin panel to control showing or hiding user names in the portal.
When "hiding" is enabled, every entry could be named with "Service Desk Team" for example.
fields.summary: Ability to hide agent name in customer portal
Include breachedDate in completed SLA cycles result in JIRA issue REST API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3305].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
At the moment, certain features are restricted to certain project types. For example, Service Desk does not have any *Releases* or *Versions* tab available. 

In JIRA versions prior to JIRA 7, this will be available for all projects and there are customers who are already accustomed to using Versions along with their Service Desk project

h3. Suggestion
If an instance has all applications (Core, Software, SD) and valid licenses, give them the option whether they want all features to be in the different project types
fields.summary: Have all 3 products features (Core Software, SD) available for projects if licenses are valid
Add more customizable SLA time to automation "When" trigger

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3301].
  {panel}

It is only possible to add an attachment to an issue in the Description field via drag&drop. It is still not possible to add an attachment with a comment or via the Attechments-Section that the customer can see / access.

We have seen the issue JSD-610 and followed the description where it's said:
_"You can add files and images to any issue in your service desk project. When working on an issue, simply drag and drop a file onto the issue, or select More > Attach files. You will then have the option to add a comment with more information about the attachment, and then share the file and comment with your customer or with your internal team only.
When adding or editing a comment, you can also select to add attachments. In this case, you'll see wiki markup added to the comment field. As soon as you share your comment, you'll see the file preview."_

So this seems to be a bug as it's said it should work.
fields.summary: Service Desk team members to attach customer-visible files to a ticket
Collaborator should be able to see the SLA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3299].
  {panel}

h3. Summary:
If we set the queue name too long, it will truncated with triple dots. Hence, it will be great if there is an option to show the whole queue name.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a new Queue.
# Insert a really long name(About more than 16 characters)
# Save the queue.

h3. Current Result:
* The Queue name will be truncated to met the size of the column for the queue.

h3. Desirec Result:
* The Queue name will be shown without truncated.
fields.summary: Ability to not truncate longer queue name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3297].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if a JIRA Service Desk project has *Anyone* added to the *Browse Projects* permission, this allows access to browse the project via the JIRA application, however not through the Customer Portal. Users are forced to login to the Customer Portal to be able to see it, even if set to *Anyone can sign up for a customer account on my Customer Portal*. This adds additional steps to customers who may be able to solve their issue with the Service Desk's linked Knowledge Base.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow for anonymous access to the Customer Portal if the Request Security is set to *Anyone can sign up for a customer account on my Customer Portal* and the *Browse Projects* permission has *Anyone* added to it.
fields.summary: Allow Anonymous Access to Customer Portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3296].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Update as of 2 February 2016|bgColor=#f5f5f5}
This issue was caused by Service Desk switching to preferring the html part of a mail message, over text, which was the previous default. The existing Html To Text converter produces a body that will cite links at the bottom.

An update has been made to the Service Desk Mail Handler, so that it will instead convert the HTML contained in an email into wiki markup.

This will work best in multipart mime messages that contain both a text and html part. Most modern clients will send multipart messages by default.

The change will be included in JSD 3.2.0-OD-02 but will not function immediately, as it also requires a change to JIRA that should be released in the next 2-3 weeks
{panel}


h3. Summary
When an e-mail request is sent in to the JIRA Service Desk project's mail handler, the mail handler parses the content of the e-mail. Any URL, Phone Number, or E-mail address within the body of the e-mail gets appended with a number in the front, and then referenced at the bottom of the ticket description. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk v3.1.0-OD-10

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable Email Requests on a JIRA Service Desk project
# Send in an e-mail to the JSD mail handler that contains an E-mail address, URL, and Phone number in the body
# Observe the change in format when the mail handler creates the ticket

h3. Expected Results
Issue Description should be formatted in the same format as when it was sent in.

h3. Actual Results
Issue is converted to a different format, causing issues with accessing the links in some cases.
 
h3. Notes
- In some cases, the issue is only reproducible with one of the following: URL, E-mail address, Phone number.
- Other formatting/styling issues such as omitted line breaks are symptoms of this bug

h3.Workaround
No known workaround.
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk Mail Handler is appending numbers to URLs, Email Addresses, and Phone Numbers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3295].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Sometimes there may be existing Confluence Spaces that already contain Knowledge Base data. Having the ability to link a single JIRA Service Desk to these spaces would be better, since that would require less Space and Page re-arranging. Not changing the pre-existing Knowledge Base environment would be less troubling for Customers as well.

h3. Suggested Solution

Have JIRA Service Desk be able to connect to multiple Confluence Spaces.
fields.summary: Multiple Confluence Knowledge Base spaces
Satisfaction surveys anonymously.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3291].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Today in Service Desk we have only the "Forgot Password" option. However, JIRA's _ForgotLoginDetails.jsp_ page has forget password as well as "forget username", but this is not being used by Service Desk.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if we can have the same "Forget Username" option in Service Desk as well.
fields.summary: Forget Username option for Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3290].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
If there is an existing user with the same email address as the one set up as the email channel, the user will be added as the Request Participant for every request created from the email.
This is as outlined in [Adding request participants|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver033/adding-request-participants-861255383.html].
{quote}
If you create or respond to a request via email, add a request participant's email address in the TO or CC fields. The participant receives an email notifying them that they have been added.
{quote}

h3. Suggestion
Do not add the user who has the same email address as the one set up as the email channel as a Request Participant automatically

h3. Workaround
Disable the user in JIRA if the user account is not in use except for the email channel

{panel:title=Original description|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3}
This is similar to [JSD-2298|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-2298] but the scenario is creating a comment by replying to a notification email.

Scenario:
1. Reporter creates an issue via email. There is a customer user with the same email address as the one used by JSD to fetch emails.
2. Reporter receives a notification email from JSD.
3. Reporter replies to the notification email. This reply creates a comment.
4. The customer user with the same email address as the one used to fetch emails is added as a Request Participant.

Expected result: at step 4, do not add this user as a request participant. It is unnecessary. This user is no longer added as a request participant when the issue is first created via email, as per the issue noted above. I think the same handling should be applied when responding to email notifications.

I did raise this as a support issue, and was told the functionality is working as intended but that I could raise a feature request.
{panel}
fields.summary: Do not add customer with same email address as the one used to fetch emails as a request participant.
Turn Off auto populated text globally

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3285].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new ServiceDesk project.
2. Add several new Request Types (10 to 15 should be sufficient)
3. Go to the Request Types overview screen and scroll down
You will see that the footer bar with the Atlassian logo is scrolling upwards too, blocking access to a request type.

See this screenshot:
 !BugJira.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: In IE12 there is an issue on the Request Types screen with the footer bar
Hi We need to upgade the Jiraserver need your technical assistance in Upgrade process.
